summary: An email chain from August 20, 2019, providing an update on the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details interviews with MCC staff and an inmate regarding potential document shredding and the circumstances of Epstein's death, as well as the service of search warrants on phone companies for records related to specific individuals.

persons.name: Steven Lopez
persons.context: Interviewed by FBINY/NYOIG regarding possible shredding of Epstein documents; stated he had no information or knowledge of any suspicious acts or document shredding by MCC employees.

persons.name: Shahada Harris
persons.context: Search warrants were served on Sprint and Verizon for cellular phones belonging to this individual to obtain call detail records and subscriber information.

events.title: Interviews regarding Epstein document shredding
events.description: FBINY/NYOIG interviewed MCC inmate Steven Lopez and several BOP MCC guards regarding possible shredding of Epstein documents and the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Search warrants served on phone companies
events.description: FBINY served search warrants on Sprint and Verizon for cellular phones belonging to Shahada Harris and an MCC employee to obtain call detail records and subscriber information.

events.title: Grand jury subpoena planned
events.description: NYOIG planned to attempt to serve a Federal Grand Jury Subpoena on a BOP MCC guard.

keyFacts: On August 20, 2019, inmate Steven Lopez was interviewed and stated he had no knowledge of any suspicious acts or document shredding related to Epstein at the MCC.
Multiple BOP MCC guards were interviewed; some refused to answer questions and requested attorneys, while others provided no significant information.
The FBI served search warrants on Sprint and Verizon for phone records belonging to Shahada Harris and an MCC employee as part of the investigation.
The investigation was actively pursuing the possibility of document shredding and irregularities related to Epstein's death in custody.
The document indicates the investigation was being conducted by FBINY/NYOIG, focusing on the MCC staff and procedures.
